original: parasparaṃ /dveṣān mokṣaḥ //🔽strī /viprakārād vā puruṣaś cen mokṣam icched yathā /gṛhītam asyai dadyāt //
analyzed: parasparaṃdveṣāt mokṣaḥ  strī viprakārāt vā puruṣaḥ ced mokṣam icchet yathā gṛhītam asyai dadyāt
translated: Divorce is possible only when there is mutual hatred.🔽If a man wishes to be divorced because of misconduct by his wife, he should return to her whatever he received from her family.

original: puruṣa /viprakārād vā strī cen mokṣam icchen naasyai yathā /gṛhītaṃ dadyāt //
analyzed: puruṣa viprakārāt vā strī ced mokṣam icchet na asyai yathāgṛhītam dadyāt
translated: If a woman wishes to be divorced because of misconduct by her husband, he should not return what he received from her family.

analyzed: amokṣaḥ dharma vivāhānām iti dveṣaḥ
translated: There is no divorce in the case of marriages based on religious principles. This is the rule regarding divorce.

original: pratiṣiddhā strī darpa /madya /krīḍāyāṃ tri /paṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt //
analyzed: pratiṣiddhā strī darpa madya krīḍāyām tri paṇam daṇḍam dadyāt
translated: A woman who has sex with a man against her will should pay a fine of three paṇas for the offense of rape and drinking.

analyzed: divā strī prekṣā vihāra gamane ṣaṣ paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: A woman who goes out to see or amuse herself during the day should be fined six paṇas.

analyzed: puruṣa prekṣā vihāra gamane dvādaśa paṇaḥ
translated: For looking at a man, for sporting with him, and for going to his house, (the woman) shall be fined twelve Panas.

analyzed: rātrau dviguṇaḥ
translated: At night, (the fine is) double.

original: supta /matta /pravrajane bhartur adāne ca dvārasya dvādaśa /paṇaḥ //
analyzed: supta matta pravrajane bhartuḥ adāne ca dvārasya dvādaśa paṇaḥ
translated: If she does not give her husband (the opportunity of) sleeping, of drinking, or of going out, (the fine is) twelve Panas for (keeping) the door (fastened).

analyzed: rātrau niṣkasane dviguṇaḥ
translated: At night, (the fine is) double.

original: strī /puṃsayor maithuna /arthenaaṅga /viceṣṭāyāṃ rahoaślīla /sambhāṣāyāṃ vā catur /viṃśati /paṇaḥ striyā daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: strīpuṃsayoḥ maithuna arthena aṅga viceṣṭāyām rahaḥ aślīla sambhāṣāyām vā caturviṃśati paṇaḥ striyāḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If a woman and a man move their limbs or talk indecently in secret for the purpose of sexual intercourse, the woman shall be fined twenty-four Panas.

analyzed: puṃsaḥ dviguṇaḥ
translated: The man (shall be fined) double.

analyzed: keśa nīvi danta nakha ālambaneṣu pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: If (a woman) pulls the hair, the braid, the teeth, or the nails (of a man), the first amercement (shall be imposed).

analyzed: puṃsaḥ dviguṇaḥ
translated: The man (shall be fined) double.

analyzed: śaṅkita sthāne sambhāṣāyām ca paṇa sthāne śiphā daṇḍaḥ
translated: If (a woman) talks with a man in a suspicious place or in a lonely place, (the fine is) a Shifada instead of a Pana.

original: strīṇāṃ grāma /madhye caṇḍālaḥ pakṣa /antare pañca /śiphā dadyāt //
analyzed: strīṇām grāma madhye caṇḍālaḥ pakṣa antare pañcaśiphāḥ dadyāt
translated: If a woman (talks with a man) in the middle of a village, (the fine is) five Shifadams at the end of a fortnight.

analyzed: paṇikam vā prahāram mokṣayet
translated: Or she may be set free on paying a Pana and a blow (of the cane).

analyzed: iti atīcāraḥ
translated: Thus (ends) adultery.

original: pratiṣiddhayoḥ strī /puṃsayor anyonya /upakāre kṣudraka /dravyāṇāṃ dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: pratiṣiddhayoḥ strīpuṃsayoḥ anyonya aupakāre kṣudraka dravyāṇām dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If a woman and a man who are forbidden (to each other) render mutual help, (the fine is) twelve Panas for small articles.

analyzed: sthūlaka dravyāṇām caturviṃśati paṇaḥ
translated: For large articles, twenty-four Panas.

analyzed: hiraṇya suvarṇayoḥ catuṣpañcāśat paṇaḥ striyāḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: For having intercourse with a woman of the same class, a fine of twenty-five paṇas shall be imposed on a man and fifty paṇas on a woman.

analyzed: puṃsoḥ dviguṇaḥ
translated: For a man, the fine is double.

analyzed: te eva agamyayoḥ ardha daṇḍāḥ
translated: For having intercourse with a woman who is forbidden to one, the fine is half of the above.

analyzed: tathā pratiṣiddha puruṣa vyavahāreṣu ca
translated: Similarly, for having intercourse with a woman who is forbidden to have intercourse with men.

analyzed: iti pratiṣedhaḥ
translated: This is the prohibition.

original: rāja /dviṣṭa /aticārābhyām ātma /apakramaṇena ca /🔽strī /dhana /ānīta /śulkānām asvāmyaṃ jāyate striyāḥ //E🔽ḷeaving home ṅoing away with a man🔽ṣhort absence from home ḷong absence from home
analyzed: rāja dviṣṭa aticārābhyām ātma apakramaṇena ca  strīdhana ānīta śulkānām asvāmyam jāyate striyāḥ  ḷeaving home ṅoing away with a man  ṣhort absence from home ḷong absence from home
translated: By enmity towards the king, by adultery, and by self-exile,🔽a woman loses her ownership over her property, dowry, and brideprice.

analyzed: pati kulāt niṣpatitāyāḥ striyāḥ ṣaṣ paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: A woman who has left her husband's family is fined six paṇas,

analyzed: anyatra viprakārāt
translated: except in the case of ill-treatment.

analyzed: pratiṣiddhāyām dvādaśa paṇaḥ
translated: For having intercourse with a forbidden woman, the fine is twelve paṇas.

analyzed: prativeśa gṛha atigatāyāḥ ṣaṣ paṇaḥ
translated: For a woman who has gone to the house of a neighbor, the fine is six paṇas.

analyzed: prātiveśika bhikṣuka vaidehakānām avakāśa bhikṣā paṇya dāne dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: For giving an opportunity, alms, or goods to a neighbor, a mendicant, or a merchant, the fine is twelve paṇas.

analyzed: pratiṣiddhānām pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ  para gṛha atigatāyāḥ caturviṃśati paṇaḥ
translated: For forbidden acts, the first sāhasa fine is imposed.🔽For a woman who has gone to another's house, the fine is twenty-four paṇas.

analyzed: para bhāryā avakāśa dāne śatyaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: For giving an opportunity to another's wife, the fine is one hundred paṇas.

analyzed: anyatra āpadbhyaḥ
translated: Except in times of distress.

analyzed: vāraṇa ajñānayoḥ nirdoṣaḥ
translated: In the case of a woman who is prevented from going or who is ignorant of the fact, there is no fault.

original: pati /viprakārāt pati /jñāti /sukha /avastha /grāmika /anvādhi /bhikṣukī /jñāti /kulānām anyatamam apuruṣaṃ gantum adoṣaḥ iti ācāryāḥ
analyzed: pati viprakārāt pati jñāti sukha avastha grāmika anvādhi bhikṣukī jñāti kulānām anyatamam apuruṣam gantum adoṣaḥ iti ācāryāḥ
translated: The teachers say that it is not wrong for a woman to go to any one of the following places which are without men, viz., the house of her husband’s relatives, the house of a person who is happy and in a good condition, the house of the headman of the village, the house of a woman who is engaged to be married, the house of a nun, or the house of her own relatives.

analyzed: sa puruṣam vā jñāti kulam
translated: Or she may go to the house of her relatives where there are men.

analyzed: kutas hi sādhvī janasya a chalam
translated: For how can there be deceit in the case of a virtuous woman?

analyzed: sukham etat avaboddhum
translated: This is easy to understand.

analyzed: iti kauṭilyaḥ
translated: Thus says Kautilya.

analyzed: preta vyādhi vyasana garbha nimittam a pratiṣiddham eva jñāti kula gamanam
translated: It is not prohibited for a woman to go to the house of her relatives on the occasion of a death, sickness, distress, or pregnancy.

original: tan /nimittaṃ vārayato dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ //🔽tatraapi gūhamānā strī /dhanaṃ jīyeta /
analyzed: tad nimittam vārayataḥ dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ  tatra api gūhamānā strīdhanam jīyeta
translated: If a man prevents her from going on such occasions, he shall be fined panas.🔽In such cases, if a woman who is concealing her pregnancy is defeated,

analyzed: jñātayaḥ vā chādayantaḥ śulka śeṣam
translated: or if her relatives who are concealing the balance of her nuptial fee are defeated,

analyzed: iti niṣpatanam
translated: this is called a case of eloping.

original: pati /kulān niṣpatya grāma /antara /gamane dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ sthāpyā /ābharaṇa /lopaś ca //
analyzed: pati kulāt niṣpatya grāma antara gamane dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ sthāpya ābharaṇa lopaḥ ca
translated: If a woman elopes from her husband’s house and goes to another village, she shall be fined panas, and her deposit and ornaments shall be forfeited.

original: gamyena vā puṃsā saha prasthāne catur /viṃśati /paṇaḥ sarva /dharma /lopaś ca /
analyzed: gamyena vā puṃsā saha prasthāne caturviṃśati paṇaḥ sarva dharma lopaḥ ca
translated: If she goes away with a paramour, she shall be fined panas, and all her property shall be forfeited.

analyzed: anyatra bharma dāna tīrtha gamanābhyām
translated: Except in the case of her paying the expenses of her husband or going to a holy place.

analyzed: puṃsaḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ tulya śreyasoḥ
translated: The man (who has intercourse with a woman of the same caste as himself) shall be punished with the first amercement; if (he has intercourse with) a woman of a higher caste, with twice that (fine).

analyzed: pāpīyasaḥ madhyamaḥ
translated: If (he has intercourse with) a woman of a lower caste, with the middlemost amercement.

analyzed: bandhuḥ a daṇḍyaḥ
translated: A relative (of the woman) shall not be punished.

analyzed: pratiṣedhe ardha daṇḍāḥ
translated: In the case of a refusal (of the woman), the fines are half of the above.

original: pathi vyantare gūḍha /deśa /abhigamane maithuna /arthena śaṅkita /pratiṣiddhāyāṃ vā pathy /anusaraṇe saṃgrahaṇaṃ vidyāt //
analyzed: pathi vyantare gūḍha deśa abhigamane maithuna arthena śaṅkita pratiṣiddhāyām vā pathi anusaraṇe saṃgrahaṇam vidyāt
translated: If a man has intercourse with a woman on a public road, in a lonely place, or in a concealed place, or if he follows a woman on the road, though she has refused him, he shall be punished with the first amercement.

original: tāla /avacara /cāraṇa /matsya /bandhaka /lubdhaka /go /pālaka /śauṇḍikānām anyeṣāṃ ca prasṛṣṭa /strīkāṇāṃ pathy /anusaraṇam adoṣaḥ //
analyzed: tāla avacara cāraṇa matsyabandhaka lubdhaka gopālaka śauṇḍikānām anyeṣām ca prasṛṣṭa strīkāṇām pathi anusaraṇam adoṣaḥ
translated: But if a man follows a woman on the road, who is the wife of a dancer, a singer, a fisherman, a hunter, a cowherd, or a distiller, or of any other man who is well known to be licentious, there is no offence.

original: pratiṣiddhe vā nayataḥ puṃsaḥ striyo vā gacchantyās ta evaardha /daṇḍāḥ //
analyzed: pratiṣiddhe vā nayataḥ puṃsaḥ striyaḥ vā gacchantyāḥ te eva ardha daṇḍāḥ
translated: If a man takes a woman (to a lonely place) who has refused him, or if a woman goes with a man who has refused her, the fines are the same as the above half-fines.

analyzed: iti pathi anusaraṇam
translated: Thus (ends) following a woman on the road.

original: hrasva /pravāsināṃ śūdra /vaiśya /kṣatriya /brāhmaṇānāṃ bhāryāḥ saṃvatsara /uttaraṃ kālam ākāṅkṣeran aprajātāḥ /
analyzed: hrasva pravāsinām śūdra vaiśya kṣatriya brāhmaṇānām bhāryāḥ saṃvatsara auttaram kālam ākāṅkṣeran a prajātāḥ
translated: The wives of Sudras, Vaisyas, Kshatriyas, and Brahmanas, who have gone abroad for a short time, shall wait for one year, if they have not got children.

analyzed: saṃvatsara adhikam prajātāḥ
translated: If they have got children, they shall wait for one year more.

analyzed: prativihitāḥ dviguṇam kālam
translated: If they have been provided with substitutes, they shall wait for twice that time.

analyzed: aprativihitāḥ sukha avasthāḥ bibhṛyuḥ
translated: If they have not been provided with substitutes, they may live happily.

original: paraṃ catvāri varṣāṇy aṣṭau vā jñātayaḥ //
analyzed: param catvāri varṣāṇi aṣṭau vā jñātayaḥ
translated: But their relatives (may take care of them) for four or eight years at the utmost.

analyzed: tatas yathādattam ādāya pramuñceyuḥ
translated: Then, having received what was given, they should be released.

analyzed: brāhmaṇam adhīyānam daśa varṣāṇi a prajātā
translated: A Brahmana who is studying should wait for ten years for a child from his wife who has not yet given birth,

analyzed: dvādaśa prajātā
translated: and twelve years for a child from his wife who has given birth.

analyzed: rāja puruṣam āyuḥ kṣayāt ākāṅkṣeta
translated: If a king's servant wishes to wait until his life ends.

analyzed: savarṇataḥ ca prajātā na apavādam labheta
translated: And if a child is born from a wife of the same caste, she should not be reproached.

original: kuṭumba /ṛddhi /lope vā sukha /avasthair vimuktā yathā /iṣṭaṃ vindeta /
analyzed: kuṭumba ṛddhi lope vā sukha avasthaiḥ vimuktā yathā iṣṭam vindeta
translated: Or if the prosperity of the family is lost, she should be released by those who are in a happy state and obtain what she desires.

analyzed: jīvita artham āpad gatāḥ vā
translated: Or if she is in a difficult situation for the sake of life.

original: dharma /vivāhāt kumārī parigrahītāram anākhyāya proṣitam aśrūyamāṇaṃ sapta tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta /
analyzed: dharmavivāhāt kumārī parigrahītāram an ākhyāya proṣitam a śrūyamāṇam sapta tīrthāni ākāṅkṣeta
translated: If a maiden is engaged in a Dharma marriage, she should wait for seven periods of impurity if the groom goes away without informing her and is not heard from.

analyzed: saṃvatsaram śrūyamāṇam
translated: If he is heard from, for one year.

original: ākhyāya proṣitam aśrūyamāṇaṃ pañca tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta /
analyzed: ākhyāya proṣitam a śrūyamāṇam pañca tīrthāni ākāṅkṣeta
translated: If he goes away after informing her, she should wait for five periods of impurity if he is not heard from.

analyzed: daśa śrūyamāṇam
translated: If he is heard from, for ten.

analyzed: eka deśa datta śulkam trīṇi tīrthāni a śrūyamāṇam
translated: If the bride-price has been given in part, for three periods of impurity if he is not heard from.

analyzed: śrūyamāṇam sapta tīrthāni ākāṅkṣeta
translated: If he is heard from, she should wait for seven periods of impurity.

analyzed: datta śulkam pañca tīrthāni a śrūyamāṇam
translated: If the bride-price has been given in full, for five periods of impurity if he is not heard from.

analyzed: daśa śrūyamāṇam
translated: If he is heard from, for ten.

original: tataḥ paraṃ dharmasthair visṛṣṭā yathā /iṣṭaṃ vindeta //
analyzed: tatas param dharmasthaiḥ visṛṣṭā yathā iṣṭam vindeta
translated: After that, she should be released by the judges and obtain what she desires.

analyzed: tīrtha auparodhaḥ hi dharma vadhaḥ iti kauṭilyaḥ
translated: For, says Kautilya, the obstruction of a holy place is a sin.

analyzed: iti hrasva pravāsaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on short-term absence, the twenty-first chapter of Book Two, dealing with disputes between husband and wife, of the Arthasástra of Kautilya.

original: dīrgha /pravāsinaḥ pravrajitasya pretasya vā bhāryā sapta tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta /🔽saṃvatsaraṃ prajātā //
analyzed: dīrghapravāsinaḥ pravrajitasya pretasya vā bhāryā sapta tīrthāni ākāṅkṣeta  saṃvatsaram prajātā
translated: For a man who is absent for a long time, or who has gone forth as an ascetic, or who is dead, his wife may wait for him for seven menses.🔽After that, she may bear a child in wedlock.

analyzed: tatas pati sodaryam gacchet
translated: Then she may go to her husband's brother.

original: bahuṣu pratyāsannaṃ dhārmikaṃ bharma /samarthaṃ kaniṣṭham abhāryaṃ vā //
analyzed: bahuṣu pratyāsannam dhārmikam bharma samartham kaniṣṭham a bhāryam vā
translated: If there are many brothers, she may go to the youngest who is near, who is righteous, who is able to support her, and who is not already married.

analyzed: tad abhāve api asodaryam sapiṇḍam kulyam vā āsannam
translated: If there is no such brother, she may go to a near Sapinda or Sagotra who is not a brother.🔽The same order applies to these.

original: eteṣām eṣa eva kramaḥ //🔽etān utkramya dāyādān vedane jāra /karmaṇi /
analyzed: eteṣām eṣaḥ eva kramaḥ  etān utkramya dāyādān vedane jārakarmaṇi
translated: These are the rules for the levirate.🔽The levir, the wife, the giver, and the receiver, having had intercourse, have incurred a sin.

analyzed: jāra strī dātṛ vettāraḥ samprāptāḥ saṃgraha atyayam  partition of inheritance
translated: The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.

original: Order of inheritance🔽anīśvarāḥ pitṛmantaḥ sthita /pitṛ /mātṛkāḥ putrāḥ //
analyzed: order or inheritance  anīśvarāḥ pitṛmantaḥ sthita pitṛ mātṛkāḥ putrāḥ
translated: The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.

original: teṣām ūrdhvaṃ pitṛto dāya /vibhāgaḥ pitṛ /dravyāṇām //🔽svayaṃ /ārjitam avibhājyam /
analyzed: teṣām ūrdhvam pitṛtaḥ dāya vibhāgaḥ pitṛ dravyāṇām  svayam ā arjitam a vibhājyam
translated: The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.

analyzed: anyatra pitṛ dravyāt utthitebhyaḥ
translated: The levirate is a means of perpetuating the family and of avoiding the sin of childlessness.🔽The levirate

original: pitṛ /dravyād avibhakta /upagatānāṃ putrāḥ pautrā vā ā /caturthād ity aṃśa /bhājaḥ //
analyzed: pitṛ dravyāt avibhakta aupagatānām putrāḥ pautrāḥ vā ācaturthāt iti aṃśa bhājaḥ
translated: The sons or grandsons of those who have not divided the property of their father, are entitled to a share, even from the fourth degree of relationship.

analyzed: tāvat avicchinnaḥ piṇḍaḥ bhavati
translated: The line of offerings to the manes remains unbroken as long as this is the case.

analyzed: vicchinna piṇḍāḥ sarve samam vibhajeran
translated: But if the line of offerings to the manes is broken, all the relatives shall divide the property equally.

original: apitṛ /dravyā vibhakta /pitṛ /dravyā vā saha jīvantaḥ punar vibhajeran //
analyzed: a pitṛ dravyāḥ vibhakta pitṛ dravyāḥ vā saha jīvantaḥ punar vibhajeran
translated: Those who live together, whether they have divided the property of their father or not, shall again divide it.

analyzed: yatas ca uttiṣṭheta sa dvi aṃśam labheta
translated: The son by whom the line of offerings to the manes is restored shall receive two shares.

original: dravyam aputrasya sodaryā bhrātaraḥ saha /jīvino vā hareyuḥ kanyāś ca //
analyzed: dravyam aputrasya sodaryāḥ bhrātaraḥ sahajīvinaḥ vā hareyuḥ kanyāḥ ca
translated: The brothers or the unmarried daughters shall take the property of a man who dies without a son.

original: rikthaṃ putravataḥ putrā duhitaro vā dharmiṣṭheṣu vivāheṣu jātāḥ //
analyzed: riktham putravataḥ putrāḥ duhitaraḥ vā dharmiṣṭheṣu vivāheṣu jātāḥ
translated: The sons or the daughters born of the lawful marriages shall take the property of a man who dies leaving a son.

original: tad /abhāve pitā dharamāṇaḥ //🔽pitr /abhāve bhrātaro bhrātṛ /putrāś ca //
analyzed: tad abhāve pitā dharamāṇaḥ  pitṛ abhāve bhrātaraḥ bhrātṛ putrāḥ ca
translated: In the absence of these, the father who is alive shall take it.🔽In the absence of the father, the brothers and the sons of the brothers shall take it.

original: apitṛkā bahavoapi ca bhrātaro bhrātṛ /putrāś ca pitur ekam aṃśaṃ hareyuḥ //
analyzed: a pitṛkāḥ bahavaḥ api ca bhrātaraḥ bhrātṛ putrāḥ ca pituḥ ekam aṃśam hareyuḥ
translated: Even many brothers or the sons of the brothers who have no father shall take one share of the father.

analyzed: sodaryāṇām aneka pitṛkāṇām pitṛtaḥ dāya vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division of the property of brothers who have different fathers shall be according to the father.

analyzed: pitṛ bhrātṛ putrāṇām pūrve vidyamāne na aparam avalambante
translated: When the father is alive, the brothers and the sons of the brothers do not inherit the property of the father.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhe ca kaniṣṭham artha grāhiṇam
translated: And the eldest son shall take the best of the estate.

analyzed: jīvat vibhāge pitā na ekam viśeṣayet
translated: In the division of the estate while the father is alive, the father shall not show any partiality.

analyzed: na ca ekam akāraṇāt nirvibhajeta
translated: And he shall not divide the estate in favour of one son without any reason.

original: pitur asaty arthe jyeṣṭhāḥ kaniṣṭhān anugṛhṇīyuḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ asati arthe jyeṣṭhāḥ kaniṣṭhān anugṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: If the father has no property, the eldest sons shall support the younger ones,

analyzed: anyatra mithyā vṛttebhyaḥ
translated: except those who are of bad conduct.

analyzed: prāptavyavahārāṇām vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division of the estate shall be made among those who have attained majority.

original: aprāpta /vyavahārāṇāṃ deya /viśuddhaṃ mātṛ /bandhuṣu grāma /vṛddheṣu vā sthāpayeyuḥ ā /vyavahāra /prāpaṇāt /
analyzed: aprāptavyavahārāṇām deya viśuddham mātṛ bandhuṣu grāma vṛddheṣu vā sthāpayeyuḥ ā vyavahāra prāpaṇāt
translated: In the case of those who have not attained majority, they shall deposit the estate in the hands of the father's relatives, or of the elders of the village, until they attain majority.

analyzed: proṣitasya vā  samniviṣṭa samam a samniviṣṭebhyaḥ naiveśanikam dadyuḥ
translated: Or of one who is absent.🔽They shall give to those who have not attained majority their shares, together with the interest accrued.

analyzed: kanyābhyaḥ ca prādānikam
translated: And to the unmarried daughters their shares, together with the interest accrued.

analyzed: ṛṇa rikthayoḥ samaḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division of the estate shall be equal, even in the case of debt and property.

original: uda /pātrāṇy api niṣkiṃcanā vibhajeran ity ācāryāḥ //
analyzed: uda pātrāṇi api niṣkiṃcanāḥ vibhajeran iti ācāryāḥ
translated: The teachers say that even those who have nothing shall divide the water-pots.

analyzed: chalam etat iti kauṭilyaḥ
translated: Kautilya says that this is a fraud.

analyzed: sataḥ arthasya vibhāgaḥ na asataḥ
translated: The division of the estate shall be made only of what is present, not of what is absent.

original: etāvān arthaḥ sāmānyas tasyaetāvān praty /aṃśa ity anubhāṣya bruvan sākṣiṣu vibhāgaṃ kārayet //
analyzed: etāvān arthaḥ sāmānyaḥ tasya etāvān pratyaṃśaḥ iti anubhāṣya bruvan sākṣiṣu vibhāgam kārayet
translated: Having said, This much is the common property, and this much is the share of each, he shall make the division in the presence of witnesses.

original: durvibhaktam anyonya /apahṛtam antarhitam avijñāta /utpannaṃ vā punar vibhajeran //🔽adāyādakaṃ rājā haret strī /vṛtti /preta /kārya /varjam /
analyzed: durvibhaktam anyonya apahṛtam antarhitam a vijñāta autpannam vā punar vibhajeran  a dāyādakam rājā haret strī vṛtti pretakārya varjam
translated: If the property is divided badly, or if it is stolen by others, or if it is lost, or if it is not known where it is, or if it is produced later, they should divide it again.

analyzed: anyatra śrotriya dravyāt
translated: The king should take the property of a person who has no heir, except for the property of a woman, the property used for the funeral rites of the dead, and the property used for the maintenance of a woman.🔽This is except in the case of the property of a learned Brahmin.

analyzed: tat traivedyebhyaḥ prayacchet
translated: He should give that to the three Vedas.

analyzed: patitaḥ patitāt jātaḥ klībaḥ ca anaṃśāḥ
translated: A person who has become an outcast, a person born from an outcast, and a eunuch are not entitled to a share.

analyzed: jaḍa aunmatta andha kuṣṭhinaḥ ca
translated: So also are a person who is dumb, insane, blind, or has leprosy.

original: sati bhārya /arthe teṣām apatyam atad /vidhaṃ bhāgaṃ haret //🔽grāsa /ācchādanam itare patita /varjāḥ //🔽teṣāṃ ca kṛta /dārāṇāṃ lupte prajanane sati /
analyzed: sati bhāryā arthe teṣām apatyam a tadvidham bhāgam haret  grāsa ācchādanam itare patita varjāḥ  teṣām ca kṛtadārāṇām lupte prajanane sati
translated: If they have a wife and a child who is not like that, that child should take the share.🔽The others, except for the outcast, should get food and clothing.🔽And if the offspring of those who have married is lost,

original: sṛjeyur bāndhavāḥ putrāṃs teṣām aṃśān prakalpayet //E
analyzed: sṛjeyuḥ bāndhavāḥ putrān teṣām aṃśān prakalpayet
translated: their relatives should beget sons and assign shares to them.

analyzed: ḍivision into shares
translated: Division into Shares

analyzed: eka strī putrāṇām jyeṣṭha aṃśaḥ brāhmaṇānām ajāḥ
translated: For Brahmins, the eldest son's share is goats.

analyzed: kṣatriyāṇām aśvāḥ
translated: For Kshatriyas, it is horses.

analyzed: vaiśyānām gāvaḥ
translated: For Vaishyas, it is cows.

analyzed: śūdrāṇām avayaḥ
translated: For Shudras, it is sheep.

analyzed: kāṇalaṅgāḥ teṣām madhyama aṃśaḥ
translated: For them, the middle share is goats with one eye or one leg.

analyzed: bhinna varṇāḥ kaniṣṭha aṃśaḥ
translated: The youngest share is of mixed colors.

original: catuṣpada /abhāve ratna /varjānāṃ daśānāṃ bhāgaṃ dravyāṇām ekaṃ jyeṣṭho haret //
analyzed: catuṣpada abhāve ratna varjānām daśānām bhāgam dravyāṇām ekam jyeṣṭhaḥ haret
translated: If there are no four-footed animals, gems, etc., the eldest son shall take one-fourth of the property, the other sons one-tenth each.

analyzed: pratimukta svadhā pāśaḥ hi bhavati
translated: For he is bound by the bond of the sacred law.

analyzed: iti auśanasaḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: This is the division according to USANAS.

original: pituḥ parivāpād yānam ābharaṇaṃ ca jyeṣṭha /aṃśaḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ parivāpāt yānam ābharaṇam ca jyeṣṭha aṃśaḥ
translated: The vehicle and ornaments belong to the eldest son from the father's estate.

analyzed: śayana āsanam bhukta kāṃsyam ca madhyama aṃśaḥ
translated: The bed, seat, and bronze vessel belong to the middle son.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ dhānya /āyasaṃ gṛha /parivāpo go /śakaṭaṃ ca kaniṣṭha /aṃśaḥ //
analyzed: kṛṣṇam dhānya āyasam gṛha parivāpaḥ go śakaṭam ca kaniṣṭha aṃśaḥ
translated: The black cow, grain, iron, house, and ox-cart belong to the youngest son.

analyzed: śeṣa dravyāṇām eka dravyasya vā samaḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division of the remaining property or of a single article is equal.

analyzed: a dāyādāḥ bhaginyaḥ
translated: Sisters are not entitled to a share.

analyzed: mātuḥ parivāpāt bhukta kāṃsya ābharaṇa bhāginyaḥ
translated: They are entitled to the bronze vessel, ornaments, etc. from the mother's estate.

original: mānuṣa /hīno jyeṣṭhas tṛtīyam aṃśaṃ jyeṣṭha /aṃśāl labheta /
analyzed: mānuṣa hīnaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ tṛtīyam aṃśam jyeṣṭha aṃśāt labheta
translated: The eldest son who is inferior to men shall receive one-third of the eldest son's share.

analyzed: caturtham anyāya vṛttiḥ
translated: One-fourth if he lives unrighteously,

analyzed: nivṛtta dharma kāryaḥ vā
translated: or if he has ceased to perform his religious duties.

analyzed: kāma ācāraḥ sarvam jīyeta
translated: If he lives licentiously, he shall be deprived of the whole.

analyzed: tena madhyama kaniṣṭhau vyākhyātau
translated: By this the middle and youngest sons are explained.

analyzed: tayoḥ mānuṣaupetaḥ jyeṣṭha aṃśāt ardham labheta
translated: If they are inferior to men, they shall receive half of the eldest son's share.

original: nānā /strī /putrāṇāṃ tu saṃskṛta /asaṃskṛtayoḥ kanyā /kṛta /kṣatayor abhāve ca ekasyāḥ putrayor yamayor vā pūrva /janmanā jyeṣṭha /bhāvaḥ
analyzed: nānā strī putrāṇām tu saṃskṛta asaṃskṛtayoḥ kanyā kṛta kṣatayoḥ abhāve ca ekasyāḥ putrayoḥ yamayoḥ vā pūrva janmanā jyeṣṭha bhāvaḥ
translated: But in the case of many sons, whether they are consecrated or not, and of a daughter, whether she is married or not, in the absence of a son or twins, the eldest son born first has the status of the eldest.

analyzed: sūta māgadha vrātya rathakārāṇām aiśvaryataḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: The Sūta, Māgadha, Vrātya, and Rathakāra castes should divide the property according to their wealth.

analyzed: śeṣāḥ tam upajīveyuḥ
translated: The rest should live on him.

analyzed: anīśvarāḥ sama vibhāgāḥ
translated: They are unequally divided, not having control over the property.

analyzed: cāturvarṇya putrāṇām brāhmaṇī putraḥ caturaḥ aṃśān haret
translated: The son of a Brāhmaṇa woman from a Brāhmaṇa should take four shares of the father's property.

analyzed: kṣatriyā putraḥ trīn aṃśān
translated: The son of a Kṣatriya woman should take three shares.

analyzed: vaiśyāputraḥ dvau aṃśau
translated: The son of a Vaiśya woman should take two shares.

analyzed: ekam śūdrā putraḥ
translated: The son of a Śūdra woman should take one share.

analyzed: tena tri varṇa dvi varṇa putra vibhāgaḥ kṣatriya vaiśyayoḥ vyākhyātaḥ
translated: By this, the division of the property of sons of the three and two castes is explained for a Kṣatriya and a Vaiśya.

analyzed: brāhmaṇasya anantarā putraḥ tulya aṃśaḥ
translated: The son of a Brāhmaṇa woman born in the next order is entitled to an equal share.

analyzed: kṣatriya vaiśyayoḥ ardha aṃśaḥ tulya aṃśaḥ vā mānuṣa aupetaḥ
translated: For a Kṣatriya and a Vaiśya, the son of a Brāhmaṇa woman should get half or an equal share, along with the human.

analyzed: tulya atulyayoḥ eka putraḥ sarvam haret
translated: If there is only one son, whether equal or unequal, he should take the whole property.

analyzed: bandhūn ca bibhṛyāt
translated: And he should maintain the relatives.

original: brāhmaṇānāṃ tu pāraśavas tṛtīyam aṃśaṃ labheta /
analyzed: brāhmaṇānām tu pāraśavaḥ tṛtīyam aṃśam labheta
translated: But for Brāhmaṇas, the son of a Śūdra woman should get one-third of the share.

analyzed: dvau aṃśau sapiṇḍaḥ kulyaḥ vā āsannaḥ
translated: The Sapinda or the Kulya who is near should get two shares.

analyzed: svadhā dāna hetoḥ
translated: and for the sake of offering the funeral oblations.

analyzed: tad abhāve pituḥ ācāryaḥ antevāsī vā
translated: In the absence of these, the father's teacher or pupil.

original: kṣetre vā janayed asya niyuktaḥ kṣetrajaṃ sutam /
analyzed: kṣetre vā janayet asya niyuktaḥ kṣetrajam sutam
translated: Or he may beget a son on his wife by a man appointed for the purpose. This son is called Kshetraja.

original: mātṛ /bandhuḥ sagotro vā tasmai tat pradiśed dhanam //E🔽Classification of sons
analyzed: mātṛ bandhuḥ sagotraḥ vā tasmai tat pradiśet dhanam  classification of sons
translated: The maternal relative or a person of the same family shall give him his share of the property.

original: para /parigrahe bījam utsṛṣṭaṃ kṣetriṇaḥ ity ācāryāḥ //
analyzed: para parigrahe bījam utsṛṣṭam kṣetriṇaḥ iti ācāryāḥ
translated: The teacher says that the seed sown in the field of another man belongs to the owner of the field.

analyzed: mātā bhastrā
translated: The mother is only a vessel.

analyzed: yasya retaḥ tasya apatyam iti apare
translated: Others say that the child belongs to the person whose seed it is.

original: vidyamānam ubhayam iti kauṭilyaḥ //🔽svayaṃ /jātaḥ kṛta /kriyāyām aurasaḥ //
analyzed: vidyamānam ubhayam iti kauṭilyaḥ  svayaṃjātaḥ kṛta kriyāyām aurasaḥ
translated: Kautilya says that both are true.🔽The son born of the wife of a man who has died without issue shall inherit his property.

analyzed: tena tulyaḥ putrikā putraḥ
translated: The son of a wife married according to the Brahma form of marriage is equal to the son of the body.

original: sagotreṇaanya /gotreṇa vā niyuktena kṣetra /jātaḥ kṣetrajaḥ putraḥ //
analyzed: sagotreṇa anya gotreṇa vā niyuktena kṣetra jātaḥ kṣetrajaḥ putraḥ
translated: The son born of a wife appointed for the purpose by a man of the same family or by a man of another family is called Kshetraja.

original: janayitur asaty anyasmin putre sa eva dvi /pitṛko dvi /gotro vā dvayor api svadhā /riktha /bhāg bhavati //
analyzed: janayituḥ asati anyasmin putre saḥ eva dvi pitṛkaḥ dvi gotraḥ vā dvayoḥ api svadhā riktha bhāj bhavati
translated: If the father of the son has no other son, the son himself, though having two fathers or two families, shall receive the funeral oblations and the property of both.

original: tat /sadharmā bandhūnāṃ gṛhe gūḍha /jātas tu gūḍhajaḥ //
analyzed: tad sadharmā bandhūnām gṛhe gūḍha jātaḥ tu gūḍha jaḥ
translated: The son born secretly in the house of a relative is called Gûdhaja.

analyzed: bandhunā a utsṛṣṭaḥ a paviddhaḥ saṃskartuḥ putraḥ
translated: The son born of a woman abandoned by her husband is called Apaviddha.

analyzed: kanyā garbhaḥ kānīnaḥ
translated: The son born of a maiden is called Kâniin.

analyzed: sagarbha ūḍhāyāḥ saha ūḍhaḥ  punarbhūtāyāḥ paunarbhavaḥ
translated: The son of a married woman is a son by remarriage.🔽The son of a remarried woman is a son of a remarried woman.

analyzed: svayaṃjātaḥ pituḥ bandhūnām ca dāyādaḥ
translated: A son born to one's wife by oneself or by one's relatives is a son by inheritance.

analyzed: para jātaḥ saṃskartuḥ eva na bandhūnām
translated: A son born to another man's wife is a son of the man who married her, not of her relatives.

analyzed: tad sadharmā mātā pitṛbhyām adbhiḥ muktaḥ dattaḥ
translated: A son given by his parents with water is a son given in adoption.

analyzed: svayam bandhubhiḥ vā putra bhāva aupagataḥ upagataḥ
translated: A son who comes of his own accord to one as his son is a son who comes of his own accord.

analyzed: putra tve adhikṛtaḥ kṛtakaḥ
translated: A son appointed as such is a son by appointment.

analyzed: parikrītaḥ krītaḥ iti
translated: A son bought is a son bought.

analyzed: aurase tu utpanne savarṇāḥ tṛtīya aṃśa harāḥ
translated: But when a son is born in the natural way, sons of the same class take a third of the estate.

analyzed: asavarṇāḥ grāsa ācchādana bhāginaḥ
translated: Sons of different classes take only food and clothing.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa kṣatriyayoḥ anantarā putrāḥ savarṇāḥ
translated: Sons of the same class are born to a Brahmin and a Kshatriya from women of the same class.

analyzed: eka antarāḥ asavarṇāḥ
translated: Sons of different classes are born from women of the adjacent class.

analyzed: brāhmaṇasya vaiśyāyām ambaṣṭhaḥ
translated: A son of a Brahmin from a Vaishya woman is an Ambashtha.

original: śūdrāyāṃ niṣādaḥ pāraśavo vā //🔽kṣatriyasya śūdrāyām ugraḥ //
analyzed: śūdrāyām niṣādaḥ pāraśavaḥ vā  kṣatriyasya śūdrāyām ugraḥ
translated: From a Shudra woman, a Nishada or a Parashva.🔽From a Kshatriya and a Shudra woman, an Ugra.

analyzed: śūdraḥ eva vaiśyasya
translated: From a Vaishya and a Shudra woman, a Shudra.

analyzed: savarṇāsu ca eṣām a carita vratebhyaḥ jātāḥ vrātyāḥ
translated: And from these, sons born to women of the same class but who have broken their vows are Vrātyas.

analyzed: iti anulomāḥ
translated: Thus are the sons of mixed classes.

analyzed: śūdrāt āyogava kṣatta caṇḍālāḥ
translated: From a Shudra, an Āyogava, a Kshattri, and a Chāṇḍāla.

analyzed: vaiśyāt māgadha vaidehakau
translated: From a Vaishya, a Māgadha and a Vaidehaka.

analyzed: kṣatriyāt sūtaḥ
translated: A Sūta from a Kṣatriya.

original: paurāṇikas tv anyaḥ sūto māgadhaś ca /
analyzed: paurāṇikaḥ tu anyaḥ sūtaḥ māgadhaḥ ca
translated: But another Sūta is a reciter of ancient lore, and a Māgadha is a bard.

analyzed: brahma kṣatrāt viśeṣaḥ
translated: The difference between a Brahmin and a Kṣatriya.

original: ta ete pratilomāḥ svadharma /atikramād rājñaḥ sambhavanti //
analyzed: te ete pratilomāḥ svadharma atikramāt rājñaḥ sambhavanti
translated: These are the offspring of intermixture born from a king due to transgression of his duty.

analyzed: ugrāt naiṣādyām kukkuṭaḥ
translated: A Kukkuṭa from an Ugra and a Niṣāda woman.

analyzed: viparyaye pulkasaḥ
translated: A Pulkasa from the reverse.

analyzed: vaidehikāyām ambaṣṭhāt vaiṇaḥ
translated: A Vainya from an Ambaṣṭha and a Vaidehikā woman.

analyzed: viparyaye kuśīlavaḥ
translated: A Kuśilāva from the reverse.

analyzed: kṣattāyām ugrātśvapākaḥ
translated: A Śvapāka from an Ugra and a Kṣattā woman.

analyzed: iti ete anye ca antarālāḥ
translated: These and others are the intermediate castes.

analyzed: karmaṇā vaiśyaḥ rathakāraḥ  teṣām sva yonau vivāhaḥ
translated: A Rathakāra is a Vaiśya by occupation.🔽Their marriage is within their own class.

analyzed: pūrva apara gāmi tvam vṛtta anuvṛttam ca
translated: They move from east to west and follow the same occupation.

analyzed: śūdra sadharmāṇaḥ vā
translated: Or they have the same duties as a Śūdra.

analyzed: anyatra caṇḍālebhyaḥ
translated: Except with regard to the Cāṇḍālas.

original: kevalam evaṃ vartamānaḥ svargam āpnoti rājā /
analyzed: kevalam evam vartamānaḥ svargam āpnoti rājā
translated: A king who behaves in this way alone attains heaven.

analyzed: narakam anyathā
translated: Otherwise he goes to hell.

analyzed: sarveṣām antarālānām samaḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: The division of all the intermediate castes is equal.

original: deśasya jātyāḥ saṃghasya dharmo grāmasya vāapi yaḥ /
analyzed: deśasya jātyāḥ saṃghasya dharmaḥ grāmasya vā api yaḥ
translated: Whatever is the law of a country, a caste, an association, or a village,

analyzed: ucitaḥ tasya tena eva dāya dharmam prakalpayet
translated: he should determine the law of inheritance for that by that alone.

analyzed: immovable property
translated: Immovable Property

analyzed: ḍwellingplaces
translated: Dwelling Places

original: sāmanta /pratyayā vāstu /vivādāḥ //🔽gṛhaṃ kṣetram ārāmaḥ setu /bandhas taṭākam ādhāro vā vāstuḥ //
analyzed: sāmanta pratyayāḥ vāstu vivādāḥ  gṛham kṣetram ārāmaḥ setu bandhaḥ taṭākam ādhāraḥ vā vāstuḥ
translated: Disputes about boundaries may be settled by the evidence of neighbours.🔽A house, a field, a garden, a dam, a tank, or a platform are called boundary.

analyzed: karṇakīlaḥ āyasa sambandhaḥ anugṛham setuḥ
translated: A dam is a structure of wood or iron fixed in the ground.

analyzed: yathāsetubhogam veśma kārayet
translated: A house should be built in such a way as to make use of the dam.

original: abhūtaṃ vā para /kuḍyād apakramya dvāv aratnī tripadīṃ vā deśa /bandhaṃ kārayet //
analyzed: a bhūtam vā para kuḍyāt apakramya dvau aratnī tripadīm vā deśa bandham kārayet
translated: Or, without encroaching upon the neighbouring house, he may build a wall two cubits or three feet high.

original: avaskaraṃ bhramam uda /pānaṃ vā na gṛha /ucitād anyatra /
analyzed: avaskaram bhramam udapānam vā na gṛha aucitāt anyatra
translated: He shall not build a wall, a rampart, or a water-course, which is not suitable for the house.

analyzed: anyatra sūtikākūpāt ā nirdaśa ahāt iti
translated: Except in the case of a well for a woman in confinement, or for ten days after delivery.

analyzed: tasya atikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: For violating this rule, the first amercement.

analyzed: tena endhana avaghātana kṛtam kalyāṇa kṛtyeṣu ācāma audaka mārgāḥ ca vyākhyātāḥ
translated: By this rule, the construction of a furnace, a threshing floor, and the water-courses for the performance of auspicious rites are also explained.

original: tripadī /pratikrāntam adhyardham aratniṃ vā gāḍha /prasṛtam udaka /mārgaṃ prasravaṇa /prapātaṃ vā kārayet //
analyzed: tripadī pratikrāntam adhyardham aratnim vā gāḍha prasṛtam udaka mārgam prasravaṇa prapātam vā kārayet
translated: He shall construct a water-course either three feet wide or one and a half cubits wide, and either sloping or falling.

analyzed: tasya atikrame catuṣpañcāśat paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: For violating this rule, the fine is forty-five paṇas.

original: ekapadī /pratikrāntam aratniṃ vā cakri /catuṣpada /sthānam agniṣṭham udan /jara /sthānaṃ rocanīṃ kuṭṭanīṃ vā kārayet //
analyzed: ekapadī pratikrāntam aratnim vā cakri catuṣpada sthānam agniṣṭham udanjara sthānam rocanīm kuṭṭanīm vā kārayet
translated: One foot (in width) and one cubit (in length) is the space for a wheel-mark. Four feet is the space for a fire-altar. One should make a place for the aged or a place for the light or a brothel.

analyzed: tasya atikrame caturviṃśati paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If one transgresses this, the fine is twenty-four paṇas.

original: sarva /vāstukayoḥ prākṣiptakayor vā śālayoḥ kiṣkur antarikā tripadī vā //
analyzed: sarvavāstukayoḥ prākṣiptakayoḥ vā śālayoḥ kiṣkuḥ antarikā tripadī vā
translated: In all houses or in houses built on a slope, the space between the two rows of houses should be one cubit or three feet.

analyzed: tayoḥ catur aṅgulam nīpra antaram samārūḍhakam vā
translated: And between them, the space for the projection of windows should be four aṅgulas or one should build them so as to project.

original: kiṣku /mātram āṇi /dvāram antarikāyāṃ khaṇḍa /phulla /artham asampātaṃ kārayet //
analyzed: kiṣku mātram āṇi dvāram antarikāyām khaṇḍa phulla artham a sampātam kārayet
translated: In the space between the two rows of houses, one should build a door for ventilation, one cubit wide, so as not to obstruct the light.

original: prakāśa /artham alpam ūrdhvaṃ vāta /ayanaṃ kārayet //🔽tad /avasite veśmanicchādayet //
analyzed: prakāśa artham alpam ūrdhvam vātaayanam kārayet  tad avasite veśmani chādayet
translated: For the sake of light, one should make a small opening above for the passage of air.🔽When the house is completed, one should plaster it.

analyzed: sambhūya vā gṛha svāminaḥ yathāiṣṭam kārayeyuḥ
translated: Or the owners of the houses may jointly have it built as they wish.

analyzed: an iṣṭam vārayeyuḥ
translated: Or they may prevent what they do not like.

original: vāna /laṭyāś caūrdhvam āvārya /bhāgaṃ kaṭa /pracchannam avamarśa /bhittiṃ vā kārayed varṣa /ābādha /bhayāt //
analyzed: vā analaṭyāḥ ca ūrdhvam āvārya bhāgam kaṭa pracchannam avamarśabhittim vā kārayet varṣa ābādha bhayāt
translated: And above the street, one should build a covered part, either roofed with planks or with plastered walls, for fear of rain damage.

analyzed: tasya atikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: If one transgresses this, the first sāhasa fine.

analyzed: pratiloma dvāra vāta ayana bādhāyām ca
translated: And for obstructing doors, windows, and air-passages against the current.

analyzed: anyatra rājamārga rathyābhyaḥ  khāta sopāna praṇālī niśreṇī avaskara bhāgaiḥ bahis bādhāyām bhoga nigrahe ca
translated: Except on the king's road, in the streets, and in the public thoroughfares.

original: para /kuḍyam udakenaupaghnato dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ /🔽mūtra /purīṣa /upaghāte dvi /guṇaḥ //🔽praṇālī /mokṣo varṣati /
analyzed: para kuḍyam udakena aupaghnataḥ dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ  mūtra purīṣa aupaghāte dviguṇaḥ  praṇālī mokṣaḥ varṣati
translated: If the water from a drain, a flight of steps, a water-channel, a sloping passage, a rampart, or a ditch causes damage to the outside (property), the owner of the drain, etc. shall be punished and made to pay compensation.🔽If a man causes damage to the wall of another by water, he shall be fined panas.

analyzed: anyathā dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If he causes damage by urine or excrement, the fine shall be panas.🔽If he lets out the water from a drain during a rain,

analyzed: pratiṣiddhasya ca vasataḥ
translated: he shall be fined panas.🔽And if a man who has been forbidden (to live in a house) lives there,

analyzed: nirasyataḥ ca avakrayiṇam anyatra pāruṣya steya sāhasa saṃgrahaṇa mithyā bhogebhyaḥ
translated: and if a man who has been turned out (of a house) lives there without having been bought (by the owner), he shall be punished with a fine of panas, except in the case of assault, theft, violence, adultery, and false accusation.

analyzed: svayam abhiprasthitaḥ varṣa a vakraya śeṣam dadyāt
translated: If a man who has gone there of his own accord, shall pay the balance of the rent for the remaining period.

analyzed: sāmānye veśmani sāhāyyam aprayacchataḥ
translated: If a man does not render help to a fellow-tenant in a house held in common,

original: sāmānyam uparundhato bhogaṃ ca gṛhe dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ //
analyzed: sāmānyam uparundhataḥ bhogam ca gṛhe dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: if a man obstructs the common use of a house, he shall be fined panas, and shall pay the value of the use of the house.

analyzed: vināśayataḥ tad dviguṇaḥ
translated: If he destroys (the house), the fine shall be double.

analyzed: koṣṭhaka aṅgaṇa varcānām agnikuṭṭana śālayoḥ
translated: The use of a storehouse, a courtyard, a street, a fire-room, and a threshing floor,

original: vivṛtānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ sāmānyo bhoga iṣyate //E
analyzed: vivṛtānām ca sarveṣām sāmānyaḥ bhogaḥ iṣyate
translated: and of all open spaces is considered to be common.

original: ṣale of immovable property Fixing of boundaries Encroachment and ḍamage
analyzed: of immovable proprity fixing of boundaries encroachment and ḍamage
translated: Settlement of immovable property, fixing of boundaries, encroachment and damage

analyzed: jñāti sāmanta dhanikāḥ krameṇa bhūmi parigrahān kretum abhyābhaveyuḥ
translated: Relatives, neighbors, and moneylenders may come forward in order to purchase the land.

analyzed: tatas anye bāhyāḥ  sāmanta catvāriṃśat kulyeṣu gṛha pratimukhe veśma śrāvayeyuḥ
translated: Then others, outsiders.

original: sāmanta /grāma /vṛddheṣu kṣetram ārāmaṃ setu /bandhaṃ taṭākam ādhāraṃ vā maryādāsu yathā /setu /bhogaṃ anenaargheṇa kaḥ kretā iti //
analyzed: sāmanta grāma vṛddheṣu kṣetram ārāmam setu bandham taṭākam ādhāram vā maryādāsu yathāsetubhogam anena argheṇa kaḥ kretā iti
translated: The neighbors, in the forty families, in the houses facing the house, should announce the field, garden, embankment, lake, or foundation within the boundaries, What buyer is there for this price, as to how to enjoy the bridge?

original: trir āghuṣitam avyāhataṃ kretā kretuṃ labheta //
analyzed: tris āghuṣitam avyāhatam kretā kretum labheta
translated: If it is announced three times without obstruction, the buyer may obtain it for purchase.

original: spardhayā vā mūlya /vardhane mūlya /vṛddhiḥ saśulkā kośaṃ gacchet //
analyzed: spardhayā vā mūlya vardhane mūlya vṛddhiḥ sa śulkā kośam gacchet
translated: Or if the price increases due to competition, the increase in price along with the toll shall go to the treasury.

analyzed: vikraya pratikroṣṭā śulkam dadyāt
translated: The one who objects to the sale shall pay the toll.

analyzed: asvāmi pratikrośe caturviṃśati paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If there is an objection by a non-owner, the fine shall be twenty-four panas.

analyzed: sapta rātrāt ūrdhvam an abhisarataḥ pratikruṣṭaḥ vikrīṇīta
translated: After seven nights, if he does not assert his claim, he may sell it after announcing the objection.

analyzed: pratikruṣṭa atikrame vāstuni dviśataḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: In the case of a building, the fine for exceeding the objection is two hundred panas.

analyzed: anyatra caturviṃśati paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: In other cases, the fine is twenty-four panas.

analyzed: iti vāstu vikrayaḥ
translated: Thus on boundaries. On sales.

original: sīma /vivādaṃ grāmayor ubhayoḥ sāmantā pañca /grāmī daśa /grāmī vā setubhiḥ sthāvaraiḥ kṛtrimair vā kuryāt //
analyzed: sīma vivādam grāmayoḥ ubhayoḥ sāmantā pañca grāmī daśa grāmī vā setubhiḥ sthāvaraiḥ kṛtrimaiḥ vā kuryāt
translated: A dispute between two villages about a boundary should be settled by the neighbours, either five or ten villages, by means of natural or artificial boundary marks.

original: karṣaka /go /pālaka /vṛddhāḥ pūrva /bhuktikā vā bāhyāḥ setūnām abhijñā bahava eko vā nirdiśya sīma /setūn viparīta /veṣāḥ sīmānaṃ nayeyuḥ
analyzed: karṣaka gopālaka vṛddhāḥ pūrvabhuktikāḥ vā bāhyāḥ setūnām abhijñāḥ bahavaḥ ekaḥ vā nirdiśya sīmasetūn viparīta veṣāḥ sīmānam nayeyuḥ
translated: Farmers, cowherds, elders, or outsiders who have been in possession of the land for a long time, either many or one, should be directed to point out the boundary marks and lead the parties to the boundary, disguised in contrary attire.

analyzed: uddiṣṭānām setūnām adarśane sahasram daṇḍaḥ
translated: If the boundary marks indicated are not seen, the fine is one thousand.

original: tad eva nīte sīma /apahāriṇāṃ setuc /chidāṃ ca kuryāt //
analyzed: tat eva nīte sīma apahāriṇām setu chidām ca kuryāt
translated: The same should be done to those who take away the boundary and cut down the boundary marks.

original: pranaṣṭa /setu /bhogaṃ vā sīmānaṃ rājā yathā /upakāraṃ vibhajet //
analyzed: pranaṣṭa setu bhogam vā sīmānam rājā yathāupakāram vibhajet
translated: Or the king should divide the boundary land whose boundary marks have been lost according to the benefits it provides.

analyzed: iti sīma vivādaḥ
translated: Thus on boundary disputes.

analyzed: kṣetra vivādam sāmanta grāma vṛddhāḥ kuryuḥ
translated: A dispute about a field should be settled by the elders of the neighbouring villages.

original: teṣāṃ dvaidhī /bhāve yato bahavaḥ śucayoanumatā vā tato niyaccheyuḥ madhyaṃ vā gṛhṇīyuḥ //
analyzed: teṣām dvaidhībhāve yatas bahavaḥ śucayaḥ anumatāḥ vā tatas niyaccheyuḥ madhyam vā gṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: If they are divided into two groups, they should be restrained by those from whom many pure and approved people come, or they should take the middle position.

analyzed: tad ubhaya parāuktam vāstu rājā haret
translated: If both sides are equally accused, the king should take it.

analyzed: pranaṣṭa svāmikam ca
translated: And that which has no known owner.

analyzed: yathāupakāram vā vibhajet
translated: Or he should divide it according to the benefits it provides.

analyzed: prasahya ādāne vāstuni steya daṇḍaḥ
translated: If he takes possession of the land by force, he shall be punished as a thief.

original: kāraṇa /ādāne prayāsam ājīvaṃ ca parisaṃkhyāya bandhaṃ dadyāt //
analyzed: kāraṇa ādāne prayāsam ājīvam ca parisaṃkhyāya bandham dadyāt
translated: If he takes possession of the land by fraud, he shall be punished with imprisonment after taking into account the labour and the value of the land.

analyzed: iti kṣetra vivādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the dispute over land.

analyzed: maryādā apaharaṇe pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: If the boundary is forcibly taken away, the first sāhasa fine shall be imposed.

analyzed: maryādā bhede caturviṃśati paṇaḥ
translated: If the boundary is violated, the fine is twenty-four paṇas.

analyzed: tena tapaḥ vana vivīta mahāpatha śmaśāna devakula yajana puṇyasthāna vivādāḥ vyākhyātāḥ
translated: By this, the disputes over penance-grove, common pasture-land, highway, cremation ground, temple, sacrificial ground, and holy place are explained.

analyzed: iti maryādā sthāpanam
translated: Thus ends the establishment of boundaries.

analyzed: sarve eva vivādāḥ sāmanta pratyayāḥ
translated: All disputes are decided on the basis of the evidence of neighbours.

analyzed: vivīta sthala kedāra ṣaṇḍa khala veśma vāhana koṣṭhānām pūrvaṃpūrvam ābādham saheta
translated: In the case of a common pasture-land, field, forest, threshing floor, house, carriage, and storehouse, the one nearer to it shall bear the loss.

analyzed: brahma soma araṇya devayajana puṇyasthāna varjāḥ sthala pradeśāḥ
translated: Excepting the land set apart for Brahmins, Soma plants, forest, temple, sacrificial ground, and holy place, all other lands are common.

analyzed: ādhāra parivāha kedāra aupabhogaiḥ para kṣetra kṛṣṭa bīja hiṃsāyām yathāupaghātam mūlyam dadyuḥ
translated: If there is any damage to the crops sown in another's field by the use of the water from the common source, or by the flow of water, or by the use of the field, they shall pay the value of the damage.

analyzed: kedāra ārāma setubandhānām paraspara hiṃsāyām hiṃsā dviguṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If there is any mutual damage to the fields, gardens, and bridges, the fine is double the value of the damage.

analyzed: paścāt niviṣṭam adhara taṭākam na aupari taṭākasya kedāram udakena āplāvayet
translated: If the lower tank is built on a higher level than the upper one, the owner of the lower tank shall fill up the tank on the higher level with water.

analyzed: upari niviṣṭam na adhara taṭākasya pūra āsrāvam vārayet
translated: If the upper tank is built on a lower level than the lower one, the owner of the lower tank shall prevent the flow of water into the upper tank.

analyzed: anyatra tri varṣa auparata karmaṇaḥ
translated: But not if the owner of the upper tank has ceased to work on it for three years.

analyzed: tasya atikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: If he fails to do so, he shall be punished with the first amercement.

analyzed: taṭāka vāmanam ca
translated: And also in the case of a tank and a dam.

analyzed: pañca varṣa auparata karmaṇaḥ setubandhasya svāmyam lupyeta
translated: The ownership of a dam on which work has been stopped for five years shall be forfeited.

analyzed: anyatra āpadbhyaḥ  taṭāka setubandhānām nava pravartane pāñca varṣikaḥ parihāraḥ
translated: But not in the case of calamities.🔽In the case of the construction of new tanks and dams, the period of limitation shall be five years.

analyzed: bhagna autsṛṣṭānām cāturvarṣikaḥ
translated: In the case of broken or abandoned ones, four years.

analyzed: samupārūḍhānām traivarṣikaḥ
translated: In the case of those under construction, three years.

analyzed: sthalasya dvaivarṣikaḥ
translated: In the case of dry land, two years.

original: sva /ātma /ādhāne vikraye ca //🔽khāta /prāvṛttim anadī /nibandha /āyatana /taṭāka /kedāra /ārāma /ṣaṇḍa /vāpānāṃ sasya /varṇa /bhāga /uttarikam anyebhyo vā yathā /upakāraṃ
analyzed: sva ātma ādhāne vikraye ca  khāta prāvṛttim a nadīnibandha āyatana taṭāka kedāra ārāma ṣaṇḍa vāpānām sasya varṇa bhāga auttarikam anyebhyaḥ vā yathāupakāram
translated: In the case of self-allotment and sale.

analyzed: dadyuḥ
translated: In the case of digging, covering, building a dam, constructing a tank, a field, a garden, a forest, or a plantation, they shall give a share of the crop or a compensation according to the benefit received from others.

analyzed: prakraya avakraya adhibhāga bhoga niṣṛṣṭa aupabhoktāraḥ ca eṣām pratikuryuḥ
translated: and those who enjoy the use of the property shall repay the value of the property.

analyzed: arpatīkāre hīna dviguṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: In the case of a sale or purchase, the fine shall be half or double the above.

original: setubhyo muñcatas toyam avāre ṣaṭ /paṇo damaḥ /
analyzed: setubhyaḥ muñcataḥ toyam avāre ṣaṣ paṇaḥ damaḥ
translated: If a person lets off water from his field through a channel other than the one provided for the purpose, he shall be fined six paṇas.

analyzed: vāre vā toyam anyeṣām pramādena auparundhataḥ
translated: If a person, through negligence, obstructs the flow of water to others,

analyzed: ḍamage to pastures
translated: in the case of damage to crops and pasture,

analyzed: fields and roads
translated: fields and roads

original: karma /udaka /mārgam ucitaṃ rundhataḥ kurvatoanucitaṃ vā pūrvaḥ sāhasa /daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: karma audaka mārgam ucitam rundhataḥ kurvataḥ anucitam vā pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: If a person obstructs or creates an obstruction in the path of water or work, the first sāhasa fine shall be imposed.

analyzed: setu kūpa puṇyasthāna caitya deva āyatanāni ca para bhūmau niveśayataḥ
translated: If a person builds a dam, well, holy place, caitya, temple or shrine on another's land,

original: pūrva /anuvṛttaṃ dharma /setum ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ vā nayato nāyayato vā madhyamaḥ sāhasa /daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva anuvṛttam dharma setum ādhānam vikrayam vā nayataḥ nāyayataḥ vā madhyamaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ
translated: If a person takes away or sells a boundary that has been in existence for a long time, or does not take it away or sell it, the middle sāhasa fine shall be imposed.

analyzed: śrotṛṛṇām uttamaḥ
translated: For the listeners, the highest fine.

analyzed: anyatra bhagna autsṛṣṭāt
translated: Except in the case of a broken or abandoned boundary.

original: svāmy abhāve grāmāḥ puṇya /śīlā vā pratikuryuḥ //
analyzed: svāmī abhāve grāmāḥ puṇya śīlāḥ vā pratikuryuḥ
translated: In the absence of the owner, the villages or virtuous people shall repay the value.

analyzed: pathi pramāṇam durga niveśe vyākhyātam
translated: The measurement of the path has been explained in the construction of forts.

analyzed: kṣudra paśu manuṣya patham rundhataḥ dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: For obstructing the path of small animals and humans, the fine is twelve paṇas.

analyzed: mahā paśu patham caturviṃśati paṇaḥ
translated: A path for large animals (is fined) twenty-four panas.

analyzed: hasti kṣetra patham catuṣpañcāśat paṇaḥ
translated: A path for elephants and fields (is fined) forty-five panas.

analyzed: setuvana patham ṣaṭśataḥ
translated: A path through a bridge or a forest (is fined) six hundred panas.

analyzed: śmaśāna grāma patham dviśataḥ  droṇa mukha patham pañcaśataḥ
translated: A path through a cremation ground or a village (is fined) two hundred panas.🔽A path through a field of grain (is fined) five hundred panas.

analyzed: sthānīya rāṣṭra vivīta patham sāhasraḥ
translated: A path through a local, national, or disputed (piece of land) (is fined) one thousand panas.

analyzed: atikarṣaṇe ca eṣām daṇḍa caturthāḥ daṇḍāḥ
translated: If (the path) is made by excessive ploughing, the fines are one-fourth of the above.

analyzed: karṣaṇe pūrvauktāḥ
translated: If (the path) is made by ploughing, the fines are as stated above.

original: kṣetrikasyaakṣipataḥ kṣetram upavāsasya vā tyajato bīja /kāle dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: kṣetrikasya a kṣipataḥ kṣetram upavāsasya vā tyajataḥ bīja kāle dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If the owner of a field ploughs (a path) or abandons (a path) in a field, he shall be fined twelve panas at the time of sowing seeds.

original: anyatra doṣa /upanipāta /aviṣahyebhyaḥ //🔽karadāḥ karadeṣv ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ vā kuryuḥ /
analyzed: anyatra doṣa aupanipāta aviṣahyebhyaḥ  kara dāḥ kara deṣu ādhānam vikrayam vā kuryuḥ
translated: Except in the case of faults, calamities, and (if the path) cannot be used.🔽Those who pay taxes may sell or mortgage (their fields) to those who pay taxes.

analyzed: brahmadeyikāḥ brahmadeyikeṣu
translated: Those who are given (fields) by Brahmins may sell or mortgage (their fields) to those who are given (fields) by Brahmins.

original: anyathā pūrvaḥ sāhasa /daṇḍaḥ //🔽karadasya vāakarada /grāmaṃ praviśataḥ //🔽karadaṃ tu praviśataḥ sarva /dravyeṣu prākāmyaṃ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā pūrvaḥ sāhasa daṇḍaḥ  karadasya vā a a karada grāmam praviśataḥ  kara dam tu praviśataḥ sarva dravyeṣu prākāmyam syāt
translated: Otherwise, the previous fine of one thousand panas (applies).🔽Or if one who pays taxes enters a village where no taxes are paid.

analyzed: anyatra agārāt
translated: But if one who pays taxes enters (a village where no taxes are paid), he may freely take anything except a house.

analyzed: tat api asmai dadyāt
translated: That also he should give to him.

original: anādeyam akṛṣatoanyaḥ pañca /varṣāṇy upabhujya prayāsa /niṣkrayeṇa dadyāt //
analyzed: an ādeyam a kṛṣataḥ anyaḥ pañca varṣāṇi upabhujya prayāsa niṣkrayeṇa dadyāt
translated: If a person who has not cultivated the land takes possession of the land for five years, he should give it to the owner after paying the value of the labour.

analyzed: a kara dāḥ paratra vasantaḥ bhogam upajīveyuḥ
translated: Those who live in another's house without paying rent should be made to pay the value of the use of the house.

analyzed: grāma arthena grāmikam vrajantam upavāsāḥ paryāyeṇa anugaccheyuḥ
translated: The villagers should, by turns, follow the village headman who goes on the business of the village.

analyzed: an anugacchantaḥ paṇa ardha paṇikam yojanam dadyuḥ
translated: Those who do not follow him should pay one pana and a half for every yojana.

original: grāmikasya grāmād astena /pāradārikaṃ nirasyataś catur /viṃśati /paṇo daṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: grāmikasya grāmāt a stena pāradārikam nirasyataḥ caturviṃśati paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If the village headman expels from the village a person who has not committed theft or adultery, he should be fined twenty-four panas.

analyzed: grāmasya auttamaḥ
translated: This is the highest fine for the village headman.

analyzed: nirastasya praveśaḥ hi abhigamena vyākhyātaḥ
translated: The re-admission of a person who has been expelled is explained by the rule of abhigamanam.

original: stambhaiḥ samantato grāmād dhanuḥ /śata /apakṛṣṭam upasālaṃ kārayet //
analyzed: stambhaiḥ samantataḥ grāmāt dhanuḥ śata apakṛṣṭam upa sālam kārayet
translated: The village headman should cause a fence to be made at a distance of one hundred dhanus from the village on all sides.

original: paśu /pracāra /arthaṃ vivītam ālavanenaupajīveyuḥ //🔽vivītaṃ bhakṣayitvāapasṛtānām uṣṭra /mahiṣāṇāṃ pādikaṃ rūpaṃ gṛhṇīyuḥ /
analyzed: paśu pracāra artham vivītam ālavanena upajīveyuḥ  vivītam bhakṣayitvā a apasṛtānām uṣṭra mahiṣāṇām pādikam rūpam gṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: The villagers should use the common pasture land for the grazing of their cattle.🔽If cattle, such as camels and buffaloes, stray into the fields and eat the crops, the owners of the fields should take one fourth of the value of the cattle.

analyzed: gava aśva kharāṇām ca ardha pādikam
translated: In the case of cows, horses and asses, they should take half of that value.

analyzed: kṣudra paśūnām ṣoḍaśa bhāgikam
translated: In the case of small cattle, they should take one sixteenth of the value.

original: bhakṣayitvā niṣaṇṇānām eta eva dvi /guṇā daṇḍāḥ /
analyzed: bhakṣayitvā niṣaṇṇānām ete eva dviguṇāḥ daṇḍāḥ
translated: If the cattle sit down to eat the crops, the fine should be double the above.

analyzed: parivasatām caturguṇāḥ
translated: Those who are in the state of probation shall pay four times the above fines.

original: grāma /deva /vṛṣā vāanirdaśa /ahā vā dhenur ukṣāṇo go /vṛṣāś caadaṇḍyāḥ //🔽sasya /bhakṣaṇe sasya /upaghātaṃ niṣpattitaḥ parisaṃkhyāya dvi /guṇaṃ dāpayet //
analyzed: grāma deva vṛṣāḥ vā aniḥ daśa ahā vā dhenuḥ ukṣāṇaḥ go vṛṣāḥ ca a daṇḍyāḥ  sasya bhakṣaṇe sasya aupaghātam niṣpattitaḥ parisaṃkhyāya dviguṇam dāpayet
translated: Cattle, such as cows, bulls, and bulls for crossing cows, which are not more than ten days old, or which belong to the village or to the temple, shall not be punished.🔽In the case of the destruction of crops, the fine shall be double the value of the crops destroyed, after taking into account the time required for their ripening.

original: svāminaś caanivedya cārayato dvādaśa /paṇo daṇdaḥ /🔽pramuñcataś catur /viṃśati /paṇaḥ //
analyzed: svāminaḥ ca a nivedya cārayataḥ dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇdaḥ  pramuñcataḥ caturviṃśati paṇaḥ
translated: If a cow is allowed to graze without the knowledge of the owner, the keeper shall be fined panas.🔽If the keeper lets loose the cow, he shall be fined panas.

analyzed: pālinām ardha daṇḍāḥ
translated: The keepers of the cows shall be fined half of the above fines.

analyzed: tat eva ṣaṇḍa bhakṣaṇe kuryāt
translated: The same rule shall apply to the case of the destruction of sugarcane fields.

original: vāṭa /bhede dvi /guṇaḥ veśma /khala /valaya /gatānāṃ ca dhānyānāṃ bhakṣaṇe //
analyzed: vāṭa bhede dviguṇaḥ veśma khala valaya gatānām ca dhānyānām bhakṣaṇe
translated: In the case of the destruction of crops in a field, a threshing floor, or a barn, the fine shall be double.

analyzed: hiṃsā pratīkāram kuryāt
translated: The owner of the field shall make good the loss.

original: abhaya /vana /mṛgāḥ parigṛhītā vā bhakṣayantaḥ svāmino nivedya yathāavadhyās tathā pratiṣeddhavyāḥ //
analyzed: abhaya vana mṛgāḥ parigṛhītāḥ vā bhakṣayantaḥ svāminaḥ nivedya yathā avadhyāḥ tathā pratiṣeddhavyāḥ
translated: Wild animals, which are protected and not allowed to be killed, shall be driven away by the owner of the field, after informing the keeper of the forest.

analyzed: paśavaḥ raśmi pratodābhyām vārayitavyāḥ
translated: Cattle shall be driven away by means of a rope and a whip.

analyzed: teṣām anyathā hiṃsāyām daṇḍa pāruṣya daṇḍāḥ
translated: If they are driven away in any other way, the fine shall be double the amount of the damage done.

analyzed: prārthayamānāḥ dṛṣṭa aparādhāḥ vā sarva aupāyaiḥ niyantavyāḥ
translated: Cattle which are allowed to graze in the field, or which are found to have committed an offence, shall be driven away by all means.

analyzed: iti kṣetra patha hiṃsā
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the destruction of fields and roads, the twentyfifth chapter in the section on Criminal Law in Book Three of the Arthashastra of Kautilya.

original: karṣakasya grāmam abhyupetyaakurvato grāma evaatyayaṃ haret //
analyzed: karṣakasya grāmam abhyupetya a kurvataḥ grāmaḥ eva atyayam haret
translated: If a ploughman does not work after having gone to the village, the village shall take away the ploughman’s share.🔽If he does not work, he shall pay double the wages for the work.

analyzed: karma akaraṇe karma vetana dviguṇam  hiraṇya adāne pratyaṃśa dviguṇam
translated: If he does not pay the wages, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.

original: bhakṣya /peya /adāne ca prahavaṇeṣu dvi /guṇam aṃśaṃ dadyāt //🔽prekṣāyām anaṃśadaḥ /🔽sasva /jano na prekṣeta //
analyzed: bhakṣya peya adāne ca prahavaṇeṣu dviguṇam aṃśam dadyāt  prekṣāyām an aṃśa daḥ  sa sva janaḥ na prekṣeta
translated: If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.

original: pracchanna /śravaṇa /īkṣaṇe ca sarva /hite ca karmaṇi nigraheṇa dvi /guṇam aṃśaṃ dadyāt //🔽sarva /hitam ekasya bruvataḥ kuryur ājñām //🔽akaraṇe dvādaśa /paṇo daṇḍaḥ //
analyzed: pracchanna śravaṇa īkṣaṇe ca sarva hite ca karmaṇi nigraheṇa dviguṇam aṃśam dadyāt  sarva hitam ekasya bruvataḥ kuryuḥ ājñām  a karaṇe dvādaśa paṇaḥ daṇḍaḥ
translated: If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.🔽If he does not pay the share, he shall pay double the share.
